question:
Green, of snow or nature,
It highlights a beautiful figure,
Of math or French,
You are the last one.
Who is it?

This vehicle is not next to the first,
But you mustn't miss it, as it is the last.
It is also a value equal to a year,
And thanks to it, sheep are separated.
Who is it?

It can give wings to throats,
It qualifies the iron we forge,
The decoration of lips,
It colors our emotions.
Who is it?

It is extraordinary at sea,
Without tomorrow and ephemeral.
To venture into it could be tragic,
On Fort Boyard, it is epic.
Who is it?

It is a crown without a king,
Whose pulp cannot be drunk,
At the top of the peaks located,
It is unfortunate to tear it off.
Who is it?

It is a long sign full of elegance,
It manages sounds and silences.
It makes a difference in shades.
Without them, intransigence sets in.
Who is it?

We keep it without failing,
So radiant for pleasure,
A sister was thus named,
Beware of the plumber's one.
Who is it?

Order where eloquence reigns,
A master king of defense.
From the chair to the ladder,
It is an essential support.
Who is it?

It is hidden in your ear,
Associated with madness,
A piano has more than one,
Be careful of its shark.
Who is it?

At the top of the masts once perched,
Its function is to watch,
Necessary for airports,
We find it at the top of the fort.
Who is it?

Tiny amount,
It is said to be easy.
In plural, it is linked
To a very large reptile.
Who is it?

It makes cries,
Tears, howls,
It is a disease,
A torture for teeth.
Who is it?

Every year, it changes incessantly,
Whether critical or ungrateful,
From flower to wisdom,
Its mystery remains.
Who is it?

Worn on the belt,
Having it makes one happy,
It is made in the hair,
It is peeled to eat.
Who is it?

We find it in Brittany,
Where they love to write their name.
It is a beautiful bowl,
One can drink soup from it.
Who is it?

Cyril Gossbo was the prettiest,
Before being thrown away.
And in the playground,
It can be made of cloth.
Who is it?

Cookie anchored in our memories,
Sweetness of childhood long and sugary,
In this place worthy of receiving,
Many secrets were entrusted.
Who is it?

We see it from beach to beach,
It competes with the clouds.
We donâ€™t eat from its pine,
It is related to the parasol.
Who is it?

It is often foreign,
And very useful for traveling.
They are legendary words
That a man, a king invented.
Who is it?

It is deprived of its half,
Isolated at the top of the page,
It is associated with the orphan.
Black, it injects its venom.
Who is it?

Whether mad or divine,
Angry or cherubic,
It evokes so much in its name,
All the flames and passions.
Who is it?

There is only a half-step,
To make it minor.
In conjugation,
It's a major asset.
Who is it?

In the air or asked for,
To have just one is to swear.
One can give it as well,
And holding it is to commit.
Who is it?

On a rough sea,
It does back-and-forth movements
Like on flattened dough.
In painting, it is commonly used.
Who is it?

By day or night,
It feeds on a trumpet,
In the swirling air.
A little of it is threatening.
Who is it?

It's a linking word
That precedes certain nouns.
Present in dust,
It is elementary.
Who is it?

It is sure or common,
And the Fort is one.
It is a complement,
This neighbor of whiting.
Who is it?

These two sisters diving into the dark,
Gaining weight when night falls,
They are the setting for our two globes,
Their makeup doesn't guide any sailor.
Who are they?

Used to cascades,
It does nothing without gravity,
Located at the end of the tale,
Pronounce it to avoid it.
Who is it?

It is in the sky or in the wind,
One we take or suspend,
And from the thief to the bird,
It is often judged very high.
Who is it?

In printing, this sure value
Is well present in writing.
Not always good or bad.
It is a whole set of traits.
Who is it?

Not rhythmic and jerky,
It can be musical.
But becomes quickly hellish,
For the worker's labor.
Who is it?

Vast stretch of land,
Paradise for the solidarity
It's a beach devoid of water,
Its vessel is always bumpy.
Who is it?

It is sometimes magical,
Often mathematical,
To roll fast and well,
You need the number 1.
Who is it?

It is a precious link of a stronghold,
An illustrious figure who comes and goes.
It is a frame made of somewhat thick cardboard.
Nothing resists this key.
Who is it?

Alpine or Nordic,
It is a telephone tool.
Who is it?

It is sometimes a transaction,
Or just a conversation.
Who is it?

Its star doesn't shine,
Its horse doesn't gallop,
Its spider doesn't sting,
Its elephant doesn't trumpet,
Who is it?

They are from a country
Rhyme with magic,
Sweet festive donuts,
There are seven in the world.
Who are they?

In nice sheets sometimes,
Its train can cause fear.
Never lacking in spirit,
It appears when night comes.
Who is it?

It amuses us, entertains us
And can be worth less than a candle,
If it needs to be calmed,
We must respect its rule.
Who is it?

It is often quite tense,
And we avoid it when we see it.
Of larks, the mirror,
Be careful of its jaws.
Who is it?

Whether a quarter or half,
It is a silence it translates.
As long as it is not the last,
We can always push it.
Who is it?

Rather pretty, well made up,
It also adorns the wounded finger,
Whether made of wax or sound,
Its face is without expression.
Who is it?

Like wrinkles on water,
From a shock, they descend to zero.
From the ground to the radio,
They follow the microphone.
Who are they?

It requires no effort,
Is difficult to seize,
And it will never return.
It is formed in an instant.
Who is it?

The fact that it is empty,
Is a failure. It always falls.
The secret of success,
Is to throw it in the back.
Who is it?
